comment: he is out of this world, take him for anything and he will give you everything you need to pass with an A. never had a more caring teacher in my life.

Professor Huet made what was supposed to be a difficult class, very manageable. He made the classroom environment uplifting, and encourages students to get out of their comfort zone. Take notes in class on what he says and study.

Prof Huet is very straight to the point. Lectures are easy and quizzes are doable if you take notes. He is very sweet and quirky, never a dull moment, however he is serious about learning and class-time being used productively.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Huet is one of the best professors I have ever had through my college experience. He is genuinely compassionate and caring which I think most professors lack and wants to see everyone succeed. He creates a class environment that is positive and makes everyone feel comfortable. He is reasonable and is always willing to work with you.

Gives very entertaining and clear lectures. He is very reasonable if you have an emergency and need flexibility so long as you have documentation. He wants everyone to be successful but also expects respect, which is very fair. I like the positive environment he creates, and he tries to be understanding of all the work we have in other classes.

He is a good professor, but not the best. He is personable and cares. His tests are stupidly hard for no reason. The wording is confusing on them too so you never do as well as you want on them. He also has pop attendance grades so you need to go to class & Some information on tests will say "from class".
This professor is not a good pick for ES 2100. Too much material and lectures don't help. Not many assignments so there isn't much in terms of grading that helps when you might miss an assignment.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Take this class if you like hearing your classmates give the wrong answers for 50 minutes without correction. class is required and surprise in class activities weigh a letter grade. Lectures are awful and uninformative despite simple course material. very difficult to work with and petty. An incredibly disappointing introduction to the ES program

he tells you at the start that everything you will need to know for his test are in his powerpoints. not true. His exams are hard and he will put in questions that he taught you one part of the question so he expects you to be able to figure it out. He also dropped me 2 letter grades on the sylb assgnt for no name at the top of an online asignmnt

Prof. Huet is an amazing instructor! He is very kind and respectful to students. Gave great feedback on assignments. Was willing to explain things several times and in multiple ways to make it easy to understand. Clear grading criteria. Wants all his students to succeed. Attendance wasn't required, but he did randomly give out in-class assignments.
Prof. Huet is a great guy, if you try at all youll do fine just attend class and look over the ppts before the exams and youll do fine.
I didn't care too much for Professor Huet. His lectures would be totally different from the exams. The way he worded stuff would throw you for a curve. Otherwise he wasn't terrible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Huet is hands down my favorite professor that I have taken at KSU. He is ALWAYS willing to help and truly wants to see everyone in his class succeed. He has clear grading criteria and will elaborate if you need help. He is very knowledgeable and a real down-to-earth kind of guy. If he's your prof, you'll be in good hands.

Took Safety Training w/ Prof Huet as a Maymester. Wasn't sure how cramming a whole semester into two weeks would work, but he gave us all the tools we needed to succeed without overcomplicating things. He welcomes questions and is willing to talk through scenarios multiple times to ensure you are maximally prepared for emergencies.

Professor Huet is a nice professor although I took his class online with five other courses. Therefore I struggled a little to keep up with his class. What he goes over in his lecture he has PowerPoint that says the same thing. His test can be a little confusing about how he words things. I would suggest taking his class only in person.

Professor Huet is GREAT! This was my first time taking his class and it was one of my favorites. He is very knowledgeable about the subject and willing to help his students with things related to the ES major. Straightforward class with a quiz per chapter, 3 exams, 1 Final, and a few assignments. Tests and quizzes are easy if you pay attention.

Professor Huet is amazing! I try to pick him for any ES class I see his name by when registering for classes! His classes are easy and he always offers extra credit or reopens his quizzes! Hes also a hilarious professor! TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Huet was definitely one of the best professors I had. My class was online due to Covid, but he made the transition very smoothly and was always asking for feedback. Although the course is a bit tricky for the new college student if you don't prepare yourself, Huet will work hard to help you learn the content if you give him the same.

Professor Huet is a true gem. He can be strict, but only because he cares so much about his students' success. He encourages students to ask questions and facilitates great in-class conversation. Take him if you can!

Huet is such an amazing person and teacher. He cares about all of his students so much and really cares about everyone's opinions and wants people to participate to get a better understanding of the material. I 100% will ALWAYS be looking out for other classes that he teaches.

Quizzes and exams are routine and easy to manage, as long a you do the chapters. It's a more lecture based class content-wise, but I used the textbook too for my notes. Tests are reasonably hard but he covers everything in his lectures, and is friendly and professional. Teaches all material and bases quizzes off of when we finish units.

Guys if you have to take him for 2100 and there are other professors out there DO NOT TAKE HIM ! I've been an A student since I started college and this is the only class that ive had this much struggle with. He gives quizzes back to back they are true and false and very tricky and the exams are even worst super hard ! lockdown and webcam also

Prof Huet is a nice guy, he can seem pretty intimidating at first but youll get used to it. I took him online, which is why I think it was so difficult to me. He knows his stuff and he excepts you to know it too, but I think his way of teaching is excessive for an intro level course. He offers no extra credit and tests get harder and harder.

Vey nice yet, class was not easy a lot of quizzes sometime twice a week. No extra credit in the class. If you miss an assignment you will not be able to make it up. Test were very hard most people failed test. Many people dropped the class. Every test you take gets harder

Hes a nice guy but I dont recommend taking him online. There are 4 test and his test became more difficult throughout the semester. He doesnt offer any extra credit. Majority of my class failed every test and he refused to reconsider questions or curve. By the end of the semester 56% of the class dropped his class. I was lucky to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is by far the best professor Ive ever had. He is very passionate about what he is teaching and wants to know his students so dont be scared to introduce yourself! There are only 3 tests but theres 13 online quizzes so do good on those and youll do good. It isnt an easy A but he makes working for it fun. TAKE HIM!

He is such an amazing professor and is respected by all of his students! I was a super shy student at the beginning of the semester and all throughout college, and he really brought me out of my shell. He teaches all the content until everyone completely understands it. I wish he taught more classes in the major because he cares so much. Take him!!

I love this professor! He makes class interactive and he gets to know his students. He knows and addresses everyone by name. Most of class is in the lab so attendance is mandatory. He explains material well and is always available to answer questions. He made cookies once! Show up on time, he hates when students are late.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring
